005package edu.wpi.first.math.system.plant;
006
007import edu.wpi.first.math.Matrix;
008import edu.wpi.first.math.Nat;
009import edu.wpi.first.math.VecBuilder;
010import edu.wpi.first.math.numbers.N1;
011import edu.wpi.first.math.numbers.N2;
012import edu.wpi.first.math.system.LinearSystem;
013
014public final class LinearSystemId {
015  private LinearSystemId() {
016    // Utility class
017  }
018
019  /**
020   * Create a state-space model of an elevator system. The states of the system are [position,
021   * velocity]ᵀ, inputs are [voltage], and outputs are [position].
022   *
023   * @param motor The motor (or gearbox) attached to the arm.
024   * @param massKg The mass of the elevator carriage, in kilograms.
025   * @param radiusMeters The radius of thd driving drum of the elevator, in meters.
026   * @param G The reduction between motor and drum, as a ratio of output to input.
027   * @return A LinearSystem representing the given characterized constants.
028   */
029  @SuppressWarnings("ParameterName")
030  public static LinearSystem<N2, N1, N1> createElevatorSystem(
031      DCMotor motor, double massKg, double radiusMeters, double G) {
032    return new LinearSystem<>(
033        Matrix.mat(Nat.N2(), Nat.N2())
034            .fill(
035                0,
036                1,
037                0,
038                -Math.pow(G, 2)
039                    * motor.KtNMPerAmp
040                    / (motor.rOhms
041                        * radiusMeters
042                        * radiusMeters
043                        * massKg
044                        * motor.KvRadPerSecPerVolt)),
045        VecBuilder.fill(0, G * motor.KtNMPerAmp / (motor.rOhms * radiusMeters * massKg)),
046        Matrix.mat(Nat.N1(), Nat.N2()).fill(1, 0),
047        new Matrix<>(Nat.N1(), Nat.N1()));
048  }
049
050  /**
051   * Create a state-space model of a flywheel system. The states of the system are [angular
052   * velocity], inputs are [voltage], and outputs are [angular velocity].
053   *
054   * @param motor The motor (or gearbox) attached to the arm.
055   * @param jKgMetersSquared The moment of inertia J of the flywheel.
056   * @param G The reduction between motor and drum, as a ratio of output to input.
057   * @return A LinearSystem representing the given characterized constants.
058   */
059  @SuppressWarnings("ParameterName")
060  public static LinearSystem<N1, N1, N1> createFlywheelSystem(
061      DCMotor motor, double jKgMetersSquared, double G) {
062    return new LinearSystem<>(
063        VecBuilder.fill(
064            -G
065                * G
066                * motor.KtNMPerAmp
067                / (motor.KvRadPerSecPerVolt * motor.rOhms * jKgMetersSquared)),
068        VecBuilder.fill(G * motor.KtNMPerAmp / (motor.rOhms * jKgMetersSquared)),
069        Matrix.eye(Nat.N1()),
070        new Matrix<>(Nat.N1(), Nat.N1()));
071  }
072
073  /**
074   * Create a state-space model of a differential drive drivetrain. In this model, the states are
075   * [v_left, v_right]ᵀ, inputs are [V_left, V_right]ᵀ and outputs are [v_left, v_right]ᵀ.
076   *
077   * @param motor the gearbox representing the motors driving the drivetrain.
078   * @param massKg the mass of the robot.
079   * @param rMeters the radius of the wheels in meters.
080   * @param rbMeters the radius of the base (half the track width) in meters.
081   * @param JKgMetersSquared the moment of inertia of the robot.
082   * @param G the gearing reduction as output over input.
083   * @return A LinearSystem representing a differential drivetrain.
084   */
085  @SuppressWarnings({"LocalVariableName", "ParameterName"})
086  public static LinearSystem<N2, N2, N2> createDrivetrainVelocitySystem(
087      DCMotor motor,
088      double massKg,
089      double rMeters,
090      double rbMeters,
091      double JKgMetersSquared,
092      double G) {
093    var C1 =
094        -(G * G) * motor.KtNMPerAmp / (motor.KvRadPerSecPerVolt * motor.rOhms * rMeters * rMeters);
095    var C2 = G * motor.KtNMPerAmp / (motor.rOhms * rMeters);
096
097    final double C3 = 1 / massKg + rbMeters * rbMeters / JKgMetersSquared;
098    final double C4 = 1 / massKg - rbMeters * rbMeters / JKgMetersSquared;
099    var A = Matrix.mat(Nat.N2(), Nat.N2()).fill(C3 * C1, C4 * C1, C4 * C1, C3 * C1);
100    var B = Matrix.mat(Nat.N2(), Nat.N2()).fill(C3 * C2, C4 * C2, C4 * C2, C3 * C2);
101    var C = Matrix.mat(Nat.N2(), Nat.N2()).fill(1.0, 0.0, 0.0, 1.0);
102    var D = Matrix.mat(Nat.N2(), Nat.N2()).fill(0.0, 0.0, 0.0, 0.0);
103
104    return new LinearSystem<>(A, B, C, D);
105  }
106
107  /**
108   * Create a state-space model of a single jointed arm system. The states of the system are [angle,
109   * angular velocity], inputs are [voltage], and outputs are [angle].
110   *
111   * @param motor The motor (or gearbox) attached to the arm.
112   * @param jKgSquaredMeters The moment of inertia J of the arm.
113   * @param G The gearing between the motor and arm, in output over input. Most of the time this
114   *     will be greater than 1.
115   * @return A LinearSystem representing the given characterized constants.
116   */
117  @SuppressWarnings("ParameterName")
118  public static LinearSystem<N2, N1, N1> createSingleJointedArmSystem(
119      DCMotor motor, double jKgSquaredMeters, double G) {
120    return new LinearSystem<>(
121        Matrix.mat(Nat.N2(), Nat.N2())
122            .fill(
123                0,
124                1,
125                0,
126                -Math.pow(G, 2)
127                    * motor.KtNMPerAmp
128                    / (motor.KvRadPerSecPerVolt * motor.rOhms * jKgSquaredMeters)),
129        VecBuilder.fill(0, G * motor.KtNMPerAmp / (motor.rOhms * jKgSquaredMeters)),
130        Matrix.mat(Nat.N1(), Nat.N2()).fill(1, 0),
131        new Matrix<>(Nat.N1(), Nat.N1()));
132  }
133
134  /**
135   * Identify a velocity system from it's kV (volts/(unit/sec)) and kA (volts/(unit/sec^2). These
136   * constants cam be found using SysId. The states of the system are [velocity], inputs are
137   * [voltage], and outputs are [velocity].
138   *
139   * <p>The distance unit you choose MUST be an SI unit (i.e. meters or radians). You can use the
140   * {@link edu.wpi.first.math.util.Units} class for converting between unit types.
141   *
142   * @param kV The velocity gain, in volts per (units per second)
143   * @param kA The acceleration gain, in volts per (units per second squared)
144   * @return A LinearSystem representing the given characterized constants.
145   * @see <a href="https://github.com/wpilibsuite/sysid">https://github.com/wpilibsuite/sysid</a>
146   */
147  @SuppressWarnings("ParameterName")
148  public static LinearSystem<N1, N1, N1> identifyVelocitySystem(double kV, double kA) {
149    return new LinearSystem<>(
150        VecBuilder.fill(-kV / kA),
151        VecBuilder.fill(1.0 / kA),
152        VecBuilder.fill(1.0),
153        VecBuilder.fill(0.0));
154  }
155
156  /**
157   * Identify a position system from it's kV (volts/(unit/sec)) and kA (volts/(unit/sec^2). These
158   * constants cam be found using SysId. The states of the system are [position, velocity]ᵀ, inputs
159   * are [voltage], and outputs are [position].
160   *
161   * <p>The distance unit you choose MUST be an SI unit (i.e. meters or radians). You can use the
162   * {@link edu.wpi.first.math.util.Units} class for converting between unit types.
163   *
164   * @param kV The velocity gain, in volts per (units per second)
165   * @param kA The acceleration gain, in volts per (units per second squared)
166   * @return A LinearSystem representing the given characterized constants.
167   * @see <a href="https://github.com/wpilibsuite/sysid">https://github.com/wpilibsuite/sysid</a>
168   */
169  @SuppressWarnings("ParameterName")
170  public static LinearSystem<N2, N1, N1> identifyPositionSystem(double kV, double kA) {
171    return new LinearSystem<>(
172        Matrix.mat(Nat.N2(), Nat.N2()).fill(0.0, 1.0, 0.0, -kV / kA),
173        VecBuilder.fill(0.0, 1.0 / kA),
174        Matrix.mat(Nat.N1(), Nat.N2()).fill(1.0, 0.0),
175        VecBuilder.fill(0.0));
176  }
177
178  /**
179   * Identify a standard differential drive drivetrain, given the drivetrain's kV and kA in both
180   * linear (volts/(meter/sec) and volts/(meter/sec^2)) and angular (volts/(meter/sec) and
181   * volts/(meter/sec^2)) cases. This can be found using SysId. The states of the system are [left
182   * velocity, right velocity]ᵀ, inputs are [left voltage, right voltage]ᵀ, and outputs are [left
183   * velocity, right velocity]ᵀ.
184   *
185   * @param kVLinear The linear velocity gain, volts per (meter per second).
186   * @param kALinear The linear acceleration gain, volts per (meter per second squared).
187   * @param kVAngular The angular velocity gain, volts per (meter per second).
188   * @param kAAngular The angular acceleration gain, volts per (meter per second squared).
189   * @return A LinearSystem representing the given characterized constants.
190   * @see <a href="https://github.com/wpilibsuite/sysid">https://github.com/wpilibsuite/sysid</a>
191   */
192  @SuppressWarnings("ParameterName")
193  public static LinearSystem<N2, N2, N2> identifyDrivetrainSystem(
194      double kVLinear, double kALinear, double kVAngular, double kAAngular) {
195    final double A1 = 0.5 * -(kVLinear / kALinear + kVAngular / kAAngular);
196    final double A2 = 0.5 * -(kVLinear / kALinear - kVAngular / kAAngular);
197    final double B1 = 0.5 * (1.0 / kALinear + 1.0 / kAAngular);
198    final double B2 = 0.5 * (1.0 / kALinear - 1.0 / kAAngular);
199
200    return new LinearSystem<>(
201        Matrix.mat(Nat.N2(), Nat.N2()).fill(A1, A2, A2, A1),
202        Matrix.mat(Nat.N2(), Nat.N2()).fill(B1, B2, B2, B1),
203        Matrix.mat(Nat.N2(), Nat.N2()).fill(1, 0, 0, 1),
204        Matrix.mat(Nat.N2(), Nat.N2()).fill(0, 0, 0, 0));
205  }
206
207  /**
208   * Identify a standard differential drive drivetrain, given the drivetrain's kV and kA in both
209   * linear (volts/(meter/sec) and volts/(meter/sec^2)) and angular (volts/(radian/sec) and
210   * volts/(radian/sec^2)) cases. This can be found using SysId. The states of the system are [left
211   * velocity, right velocity]ᵀ, inputs are [left voltage, right voltage]ᵀ, and outputs are [left
212   * velocity, right velocity]ᵀ.
213   *
214   * @param kVLinear The linear velocity gain, volts per (meter per second).
215   * @param kALinear The linear acceleration gain, volts per (meter per second squared).
216   * @param kVAngular The angular velocity gain, volts per (radians per second).
217   * @param kAAngular The angular acceleration gain, volts per (radians per second squared).
218   * @param trackwidth The width of the drivetrain in meters.
219   * @return A LinearSystem representing the given characterized constants.
220   * @see <a href="https://github.com/wpilibsuite/sysid">https://github.com/wpilibsuite/sysid</a>
221   */
222  @SuppressWarnings("ParameterName")
223  public static LinearSystem<N2, N2, N2> identifyDrivetrainSystem(
224      double kVLinear, double kALinear, double kVAngular, double kAAngular, double trackwidth) {
225    // We want to find a factor to include in Kv,angular that will convert
226    // `u = Kv,angular omega` to `u = Kv,angular v`.
227    //
228    // v = omega r
229    // omega = v/r
230    // omega = 1/r v
231    // omega = 1/(trackwidth/2) v
232    // omega = 2/trackwidth v
233    //
234    // So multiplying by 2/trackwidth converts the angular gains from V/(rad/s)
235    // to V/m/s).
236    return identifyDrivetrainSystem(
237        kVLinear, kALinear, kVAngular * 2.0 / trackwidth, kAAngular * 2.0 / trackwidth);
238  }
239}
